str2: When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

word: they were not walking in line
parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From a compound of orthos and pous; to be straight-footed, i.e. to go directly forward.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From alethes; truth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Of Chaldee origin; the Rock; Cephas, a surname of Peter.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
In the manner of Gentiles, like the rest of the world. Adverb from ethnikos; as a Gentile.
And, even, also, namely.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
In the manner of Jews (religiously, ceremonially). Adverb from Ioudaikos; Judaically or in a manner resembling a Judaean.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To force, compel, constrain, urge. From anagke; to necessitate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
To live as a Jew (in religion, ceremonially). From Ioudaios; to become a Judaean, i.e. 'Judaize'.
